results.title: Hair growth defects in Insig-deficient mice caused by cholesterol precursor accumulation and reversed by simvastatin.
results.text_hl: Topical treatment of Epi-Insig-DKO @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, an inhibitor of reductase, reduced @CHEMICAL_Sterols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013261 @@@sterol@@@ precursors in skin and corrected the @DISEASE_Hair_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D006201 @@@hair@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Skin_Abnormalities</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012868 @@@skin defects@@@.

citations.NLM: Evers BM, Farooqi MS, Shelton JM, Richardson JA, Goldstein JL, Brown MS, Liang G. Hair growth defects in Insig-deficient mice caused by cholesterol precursor accumulation and reversed by simvastatin. J Invest Dermatol. 2010 May;130(5):1237-48. PMID: 20090767
